data.title: Ultrastar, Stepmania, FoFiX
data.meta_description: I'm using all of those music games. There is a lot of BGM songs for Ultrastar, Stepmania and FoFiX. BGD songs for Ultrastar are from Aqua, Toy-box and Rednex. For Stepmania is some great danc
data.text:
Post by joze84 on

Well, Ultrastar is a free Singstar game that can be played on a computer.

It works on windows and linux.

Nowadays the game is pretty stable.

Ultrastar game can be downloaded from sourceforge.net/projects/ultrastar/

Ultrastar DX and CMD from ultrastardx.sourceforge.net/usdx-downloads/usdx/#stable

Ultrastar World Party from ultrastar-es.org/descargas.php?id=45

Songs can be found from ultrastar-es.org/canciones.php and www.ultrastar-base.com

Differences in other versions in that Ultrastar is the basic game, DX is newer version, CMD includes duet and some other game types and world party is made by ultrastar-es and it can load high scores from and to websites.

Just plug in normal microphone or PS or Xbox singstar mics to yout PC and start singing.

FoFiX is rock band type of game to PC.

FoFiX is newer version of Frets on Fire that is Guitar hero for PC and it's finnish open source game.

FoFiX game can be from code.google.com/p/fofix/ and fretsonfire.wikidot.com/fofix/

Homemade songs can be downloaded from www.fretsonfiresongs.com/ and from fretsonfire.wikidot.com/custom-songs

great site to download full rock band song packs was www.fofitalia.altervista.org/, but unfortunatly songs can't be downloaded any more.

Guitar hero and rock band songs are mostly rock songs, but as a dance fan, I recommend to try Band hero and lego rock band.

There is other sites where to download songs and google is a good way to find those.

FoFiX can use PS and Xbox rock band guitars, drums and mics.

And then there is Performous, whitch includes all of those music games in one game.

It's also a finnish game, but it's a little bit different to play.

With performous you can play ultrastar, FoFiX and Stepmania songs.

You can download Performous from performous.org/download

Post by ChaoticRage on

You can get some pretty good Stepmania Sim files here:

zenius-i-vanisher.com/v5.2/index.php

They have a really nice selection.

It's a shame there are not many decent hard DDR pads made/sold anymore like the cobalt flux. Most credible companies like Red Octane and BG-Mania have folded over the years so getting a decent hard pad is difficult. The most common hard pads I see these days are the DDR-Energy or Ion-Master pads and both of these will get torn up and break within months if you play skill levels above Another/Trick/Standard/Difficult routinely.

These days if you want a good hard pad you pretty much have to either build your own or shell out 900+ US for a commercial level Hard Pad. The materials for building your own will usually run around 200ish US nowadays and take anywhere from 10 to 40 hours to build depending on your tools, hands-on skills, and what level of refinement you want in your pads. For those interested in building their own pad, here is a good thread on it:

zenius-i-vanisher.com/v5.2/viewthread.php?threadid=3350

I actually built one off of similiar instructions back in 2004 and it's been holding up well, but it requires a lot of maintenance to keep working and when something breaks I have to make the replacement parts myself which can take hours. When probably maintained it does works better than Arcade Pads though!

The nice thing about building your own is that you can put a connector on the edge of the wires(leading to the arrow contacts) and put the opposite style connector on any controller you want to use. I've put one connector into a PS1 controller for PSX/PS2 DDR games. I also put one on an XBOX360 Controller so that I can play X360 DDR mixes and also use it for Stepmania. I can switch between controllers in seconds! I am also working on a Gamecube controller so I can also use it on Wii mixes, but that is low on my priority list!

For those willing to spend a lot on commercial pad, Positive Gaming has a pad they call the Impact Arcade Platform:

www.positivegaming.com/active-gaming-and-machine-dance-products/impact-dance-platform

I've had one of them for a year now and have played on it for about a few hours every week. I have not had any functional problems, though the arrows are about 3 millimeters lower than the rest of the pad surface. Here is a 1/4 inch Stereo Jack adapter ontop one of the arrows from the side;

For some people this wont make any difference but for those who drag their feet it will cause problems! The arrow sensitivity is extremely high so you don't need to step very hard.
